comments.text:
Created attachment 539132
Confifuration for tuffmail

They seem to offer a lot of nice features.

I don't have an account so untested.
comments.author: ludovic@hirlimann.net
comments.creator: ludovic@hirlimann.net
comments.raw_text:
They seem to offer a lot of nice features.

I don't have an account so untested.
It makes more sense to use port 443 for both the IMAP server and the SMTP server, because it will work through more firewalls.
comments.text: It makes more sense to use port 443 for both the IMAP server and the SMTP server, because it will work through more firewalls.
comments.author: brian@briansmith.org
comments.creator: brian@briansmith.org
ben.bucksch@beonex.com
comments.text:
> <leaveMessagesOnServer>true</leaveMessagesOnServer>

This is not healthy, it will get very slow over time. We should use the TB defaults. Remove this.

Config looks good otherwise, but:

This must be tested before we can allow it in the DB. Please create a test account or (if pay only) email their support to get one.
comments.author: ben.bucksch@beonex.com
comments.raw_text:
> <leaveMessagesOnServer>true</leaveMessagesOnServer>

This is not healthy, it will get very slow over time. We should use the TB defaults. Remove this.

Config looks good otherwise, but:

This must be tested before we can allow it in the DB. Please create a test account or (if pay only) email their support to get one.

Tuffmail

IMAP: mail.mxes.net, 143, STARTTLS, password-cleartext
 IMAP: mail.mxes.net, 443, SSL, password-cleartext
 IMAP: mail.mxes.net, 993, SSL, password-cleartext
POP3: mail.mxes.net,  110, STARTTLS, password-cleartext
 POP3: mail.mxes.net,  995, SSL, password-cleartext
SMTP: smtp.mxes.net, 587, STARTTLS, password-cleartext
 SMTP: smtp.mxes.net, 443, SSL, password-cleartext
 SMTP: smtp.mxes.net, 465, SSL, password-cleartext
 SMTP: smtp.mxes.net, 25, STARTTLS, password-cleartext
Username %EMAILADDRESS%


documentation url=" http://www.tuffmail.com/ports.php "
   descr lang="en" Tuffmail - Help: Access Ports and Protocols

documentation url=" http://www.tuffmail.com/client-config.php "
   descr lang="en" Tuffmail - Help: IMAP, POP3, and LDAP Configuration
